ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Overall, this was a great course as an introduction to archaeological methods, approaches and definitions pertaining to various scales of analysis related to settlements.
It is an important course for it is essential for the students who study archaeology. Definitely, I will recommend to other students.
Yes, I would like to recommend this course to another students. Settlement is very useful for archaeological research, and this course is good for students to find what they really interest in.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course was very helpful in preparation for my dissertation research.
I have deeper understanding of the settlement archaeology and learn how settlement archaeology is proceeded in many regions of the world.

Learning different theories and methods from all over the world is very inspiring for my own research. It inspires me to jump out of my previous limited knowledge and broadens my view. It is really helpful.
